citeinfo.title: 2002 (Feb.) U.S. Echo Integration-trawl Survey Data for Walleye Pollock (Theragra chalcogramma) in the Shumagin Islands, Pavlof Bay, and Sanak Trough - R/V Miller Freeman (Cruise ID: MF2002-02)

abstract.p: Scientists from the Midwater Assessment and Conservation Engineering (MACE) Program of the Alaska Fisheries Science Center conducted research surveys of Gulf of Alaska walleye pollock (Theragra chalcogramma) to estimate pollock distribution and abundance. This echo integration-trawl (EIT) survey was carried out between 10 and 16 February, 2002, in the Shumagin Islands, Pavlof Bay and Sanak Trough.

Acoustic data were collected with a Simrad EK 500 quantitative echo-sounding system. Physical oceanographic data collected throughout the cruise included temperature/depth profile data obtained by attaching a Seabird SBE39 micro bathythermograph to the trawl headrope and conductivity-temperature-depth (CTD) data collected with a Sea-Bird CTD system at the calibration site and other selected locations. Sea surface temperature, salinity, and other environmental data were also collected and logged. Biological data, including those for ancillary research projects, were collected from one bottom trawl and five midwater trawl hauls.

Cruise ID: MF2002-02 (10 Feb - 17 Feb)
Survey vessel: NOAA ship R/VMiller Freeman

descript.purpose: The primary cruise objective was to assess the abundance and distribution of pollock.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
